dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 21, 2022
titles: "UPDATE 3" - It has some downsides but good overall.
reviews: \nFINAL UPDATE!!!If you have a dot already and you're not in a rush to update you're not missing out. The sound quality is better. Like most people I connect my dot to a Bluetooth speaker. So the updated sound quality is mute.The Eero installed mesh wifi is cool if you need to kill a dead zone. Definitely worth it ONLY IF you already have and Eero or plan on getting one. Tech support isn't the best in this department. Read below. When I did get the tech support in the U.S. the knowledge of the Eero wifi was much better. The Tech Support they out source to foreign countries is terrible. They told me the Dot and the Eero don't work together because I didn't buy them together. Amazon was quick to give me a phone call after my review so know that they do read reviews and in good faith will do everything to rectify the problem (A huge plus for Amazon.)So the problem I had was not with the Echo Dot, but with the Eero wifi mesh extender.With the Eero it's all about placement when it comes to these Echo dots. You want your Echo to be in the 5ghz range and NOT the 2.5Ghz. range. Do what you can to get the hub closer. It makes a HUGE difference. I did some digging online and found out that the Eero does well and placed up high also. I purchased a 100 foot cat5 network cable ($17). I Moved the Eero hub to the center of the house. I set it on top of a cabinet. The back room, where I was pulling 5-20mps is up to 432mps download. That's without using the Eero extension on the Echo Dot.The dot has a motion sensor and tempurature sensor that works with my Smartthings Hub. I have not used them because I already have motion and temp sensors in this room that have active scenarios working.I'm going to keep this one and test the sensors a bit more and compare them to ones I have set up already.I would give this four stars but I can't overlook the comedy of foreign tech support. This would've been a frustrating experience if I was pressed to get things working.ANOTHER UPDATE!!!!This junk is going back to the pit of hell it came from. Both of them. It's a good idea but fails in its execution.The Eero built into these are random. Sometimes you connect, sometimes you don't. I could stand a foot away from it and it will not connect to the Eero.This is a BRAND NEW product. If you buy this know that you are part of the BETA TEST crowd. You are the guinea pigs that Amazon is perfecting this on. So you pay your money so they can test this out.On one of my many calls to tech support they told me they only had very little training on these.The old wifi worked better than this.IT IS NOT READY FOR PRIME TIME!!!!!!!!  WAIT TILL THEY WORK THE KINKS OUT!!!!New update!!!They don\u2019t know what the hell they are doing at tech support.Stupid stuff I was told.1. It will only work when you buy them together. (The Eero and Echo dot with Eero installed.)Firmware needs to update. \u201cHow do I do that?\u201d I ask. \u201cI escalated the ticket to a higher level tech support.\u201d I hung up. Called back and got a different tech. They told me to update simply tell Alexa,\u201dAlexa, update firmware.\u201d Like I told the other tech, the firmware is updated. Two tech calls ago the guy did it.So now they say they gotta call me back because they need to figure it out. LOL!!!!!STOOOOPID!This gets worse and worse. So now I\u2019m on the phone AGAIN with tech support. This idiot told me the Echo Dot with EERO won\u2019t work with the Eero mesh I purchased because ,\u201dI did not buy them together.\u201d What special kind of stupid is this!! So Eero is putting their name on products that do NOT work with other EERO products. I asked to speak to someone else. I\u2019ve been on hold for 20min.Amazon got something\u2019s right but this is a mess.Tech support has no clue on how to fix this. I\u2019m going to return this crap. But now I want to see how dumb tech support is.They asked which model do I have.There\u2019s only one with EERO in it.She didn\u2019t know that.Ten minutes later and I\u2019m back on the phone with tech support. Signal drops constantly. Tech support no help on this one hot piece of garbage!!!!I spent some time on the phone with tech support. This had to be configured so the Eero would work. I\u2019m getting good download speeds now. I hope it lasts. The sound is a bit of an improvement. More bass and highs. It\u2019s not easy to set up the Eero. They had to. Get inside and configure it to work. A hassle but it works. Tech support for Amazon can\u2019t help. Call the Eero hot line.This won\u2019t even hold the wi-fi signal. My router is the the living-room. The download speeds standing next to the Eero mesh wifi is great. 550mps.In the office I installed the New Echo dot with eero installed for mesh. Without the Echo dot I\u2019m getting 91mps. That\u2019s just off the Eero transmitting from the living room. Better than I expected.Now when I hook the Echo Dot up and I run the test.I get a whopping 0.14 mbps download. I\u2019m sitting a foot away from it.Total garbage.\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 27, 2023
titles: Easy setup and operation. Works well - but there are bugs - be aware
reviews: \nOk, bugs first: Adaptive listening is a huge problem. It causes Alexa to mis recognize things. For me, telling Alexa to turn on either the Office AC or the bedroom AC caused her to turn on EVERYTHING in the room. BEfore you start giving me suggestions - don't waste your breath. I have already spoke with tech twice and PROVEN that there is a bug in the adaptive listening that causes her to do things she was not asked to do or to NOT do things she was asked to do.Otherwise, it's PERFECT! There are some issues still with other apps that interact with Alexa, but those aren't her fault!Overall, I'm SUPER happy I moved from Google Home devices to the Echo devices! I'm still learning, but overall pretty happy with them at this point!\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 28, 2023
reviews: \nThe speaker has a very high quality sound output relative to its size and even if it was four times bigger I would still be happy with the sound quality and loudness that comes out. And it came with this light bulb that I can tell Alexa to dim it to whatever percentage I want to and to turn it on and off whenever I want to which is actually really cool.It would be nice if behind the cloth that in cases this little sphere, that it would display the time and temperature. But at last, it does not, so now I either have to speak out loud and ask Alexa or I have to go get my phone and look at it to see the time. It's trivial but and actually makes a big difference compared to if it did or did not have that feature.They also make it a pain in the butt for the setup procedure. Most people just want to screw the lightbulb in plug in the Alexa and tell it to play music or tell it to tell me the forecast of the day and to set an alarm and to dim a light or turn it off or make it brighter. I don't need 600 questions during the setup procedure. It's like, just let me set it up and get the basics and I can find tune it later. You don't buy a house and then get asked $6,000 things that you want to do to your house and your hopes and dreams for the house. You literally just address those things as they come along while you live at the house. And that's how it should be with this speaker thing. I'm just a man who doesn't have a lot of patience and I acknowledge that, so that's just purely a subjective opinion from an inpatient man that appreciates the sound quality and features of this Amazon Alexa speaker thing\n
config_color: Color: Glacier WhiteConfiguration: w/ Philips Bulb

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 16, 2023
reviews: \nThe person I bought this for is disabled and is paralyzed from the neck down and we were having problems with the Samsung\u2018s voice activation on the phone and we couldn\u2019t get it to work so I discovered this little echo dot and it took some time to set it up even for someone it kind of knows what they\u2019re doing but once you set it up with the app you can set it up to where no one can get into it into your account they can just access the data itself and it works really well with Samsung even though the Samsung phone locks it\u2019ll still activate calls it I still call people and you\u2019re still on to texting for you if you want so it works out really well for the sky cause he can\u2019t use his hands at all\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 26, 2023
titles: This little ball is a miraculous item
reviews: \nMy wife is legally blind and in need of a device to assist her with everyday chores.  This does it all.  She can make calls, receive calls, it is paired with our Dish TV Receiver and she can change channels without the touch controller which she has problems locating the proper buttons.  It is also paired with our AT&T contact list snd she can call any of our contacts by name.  This thing is fantastic.  And setup was a bit lengthy but the step by step guides made it relatively easy and error free.  I highly recommend this product.  It is very small by full of ability.\n
config_color: Color: Glacier WhiteConfiguration: w/ Smart Plug

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 25, 2023
titles: All in all a good device, but the sound is really its weak point.
reviews: \nAfter four months of usage I can finally give an educated opinion on this version of the Echo device.As my title states, overall it is a "good" device with a few weak points.Voice recognition is good, processing of commands is fast (I own every single version of echo and older echos take longer to give results of your requests)The temperature sensor was a nice addition, but it doesn't work. I have three of these devices in three different places around my house, every place has a different temperature yet they all seem to report the same temperature that is NOT an average either so..... what is it measuring then?Sound is where it lacks the most. The sound reproduction is dull, even kind of muffled. If you got it as a BT speaker to actually enjoy music then look somewhere else. I have found that sound is VERY inconsistent between these devices. I have a few echo 3 devices and they sound "ok" but one of them has SUPERB sound. It baffles my mind how this can be possible, but there it is.All in all, it is a good device and I recommend it, hence why I keep buying them. BUT it depends if you are going to use them at their fullest or just as a BT speaker. If for only the latter, then look somewhere else.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 18, 2023
titles: Buy an Alexa, You'll like it !
reviews: \nMy friends kept telling me I should buy an Alexa. One friend gave me a demonstration of how easy and fast it was to obtain an internet radio station. Or how quickly it will solve mathematical problems. I was convinced, and bought one. Liked it so much I immediately ordered 4 more. Turns out you can synchronize all of them, so they play the same radio station or music in each room of your home. Although Alexas are smaller than a softball, they have amazingly rich sound. No, they won't replace my $2500 stereo system, but they have replaced all my internet radios and boom-boxes. Soon, I'll be installing electric switches the Alexa can control. Buy an Alexa. You'll like it !\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 29, 2023
reviews: \nI recently traded my Echo Show for this Echo dot. Here's the deal, I originally thought, "having a screen on the echo that I have in the kitchen will allow me to look at recipes and allow me to see people that ring the doorbell on my blink doorbell!" But did I ever actually use any of those features? Nope.Now aside from just having extra features that I did not use, I could not stand how many ads would show on the screen regularly. As a parent with toddlers who love to ask about everything they see, the least amount of screens around my house, the better.I enjoy the functionality of Alexa and the integration with my other smart home items, but I'm not sure I'm ready to trade ease of use for ads in my face. As someone who owned the very first Echo that was released, these things have come a long way. The audio quality is by no means killer, but it will definitely serve to play your music or a storybook for your kids with plenty of volume to spare. If you are using the Eero wifi system, this will also serve as a range extender, allowing you to have your other Eero devices in other parts of the house.So in conclusion, unless you are certain that you need another screen in your house, save yourself the money and get this Echo.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 27, 2023
reviews: \nI love Amazon Echo products & purchased this for my first apartment. I love the size of it & how light and portable it is so I can move it from room to room as needed. The Echo Dot has all of the features I need & it\u2019s great for white noise, setting reminders and timers, communicating remotely with the Alexa app, and playing games with the family. Highly recommend this model if you have never had an Echo before or if you need something that works in a small space.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 26, 2023
reviews: \nI use it mainly as an outdoor speaker for music and listening to ball games, news, etc.Volume is plenty to cover the outdoor surrounding sounds.....birds, traffic, etc.I bought mine with the charging base. That eliminates the need for extension cords for radios and the like.The wirelessness is the main reason I purchased it and am not disappointed.My Kindle just did not have enough power to overcome the outdoor ambient noise.I don't use it to control any Smart Plugs since I do not have any and never found them necessary.\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 7, 2023
reviews: \nWe've been using Alexa for years for controlling lights, garage door opener, video doorbell, thermostat, television and streaming!  We are constantly asking Alexa to turn on or off certain lights, or changing light colors, etc.The new gen of Echo Dot has Ultrasound Motion Detection which is a game changer here!  That detection capability can be used to detect motion with adjustable sensitivity and range.  Combined with two new Routines per Echo Dot, one to turn on the lights when motion is sensed and one to turn off lights when there is no motion sensed, we've completely automated lighting in the house.  In the past week I've made the Routines time-based so we can have a brighter white light color during daytimes and a software off white light color as it gets darker outside.So far the only issue with Echo Dot was the placement of all of the Echo Dots.  Here it is very important so we can avoid unnecessary lights going on and off.  It took a week or so to get the combination of placement, motion-detection sensitivity and range dialed in and we are very happy with the results!Now there will be no more fumbling around for light switches when needing a glass of water at night, and no more wasted electric when lights are left on :)  I'm very happy with the Motion Detection features, and it makes a great addition to all of the other features of Alexa's that we use.The one con I've personally faced is now that there are some rooms with more than one Alexa device, the language I used prior with Alexa is ambiguous and she points that out.  That's why I deducted a star.Update 1/12/2023 - One room in the house has a dehumidifier and air purifier and they are running quite often this time of year which generates a constant background noise.  Even with Echo's Ultrasound Motion Detection set to high Sensitivity and Range, I'm finding that I have to snap my fingers or make another noise that is louder than the background noise before the lights are turned on.  However, even with the background noise Echo is able to detect when we leave the room and turns the lights off as expected.  I'm not going to deduct anything from the rating because this makes sense to me, and I believe they'll work this out with a near future updated.Overall I'm still happy with the new generation Echo Dots!\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 21, 2022
titles: The first thing I noticed was What?
reviews: \nI am a huge fan of this deep black color, I think any color options for the 5th generation would be great but mine is black. No digital clock, wasn\u2019t expecting it with the darker color option but i don\u2019t think i have met anyone who has not agreed with me that the clock will look much better in the darker color echo. More offset and the matching color combination, even maybe a better contrast making the digital clock light red, orange, or purple? I\u2019m just going to hope that Amazon sees this and uses it, and then all i will want is a new digital version with one of my color ideas. Buy this one for the sound and the 5G connection. I\u2019m having a few issues as I am positive most people can relate. The largest and most frustrating is the combination of speaker environments. I can get this 5th generation echo linked to my 4th generation echo as speakers L and R. They are not able to connect with anything else however. Even if they are disconnected and forgotten from their bond they won\u2019t connect with the other speakers. I speak of one speaker specifically and that\u2019s my top of the line Studio. The greatest speaker, surround sound, Dolby, device hub studio speaker. I\u2019m told over and over that it isn\u2019t compatible with the Alexa devices on network tho can connect with the 2 Sony soundbars I linked together before digital plug in to the TV. Though studio is not able to provide sound for this type of connection. It\u2019s made for a simple audio interfaced system. Preferably the devices that share a name with it\u2026 at a loss. But if you use it Bluetooth from your iPhone the sound is very impressive. Especially when it\u2019s such a small device. Even when it\u2019s having trouble getting connected I still say it\u2019s worth it. Who knows, maybe my problem is specifically mine and not something that is a known issue, I haven\u2019t been able to find many others that are experiencing this issue.. I can say I am very competent with electronics, connections, networking, and other skills learned taking advantage of the free opportunities available from Microsoft, google, amazon, GitHub, and many others. A lot of free resources are available for everyone and I say that you should take full advantage of them as soon as you finish the purchase of your echo 5th gen\n

reviews: \nI received this free from Verizon as a gift for being an internet customer. I had been thinking about getting an Alexa speaker and would have probably purchased the one that displays the time but I'm really happy with my Alexa. I did change the voice to an Australian guy's voice and then he named himself Ziggy. I enjoy that it links to my fire stick and I can just ask it to tune to a certain show and he does. Since I'm planning on eventually upgrading to more smart home features, I suppose this freebie will be steering me towards the ones that integrate with Alexa. He reminds me to feed Asher every day at 7 and is quick to answer any questions about the weather or anything that I can think to ask.\n

reviews: \nI had, still do, the 2nd generation Echo Dot. It was constantly disconnecting from my wifi, so I thought a newer one would work better. It's been a couple of weeks and it hasn't disconnected that I've noticed. the sound is much punchier with more bass than the 2nd gen Dot, which is great.The only real problem I have with this new 5th gen Dot aside from the weird sphere shape, is that the adaptive voice volume doesn't seem to work properly. But for me, sometimes the voice is low and sometimes the voice is louder...even though the volume of the room doesn't change it's not that big of a deal, though.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 27, 2023
reviews: \nI am in the process of upgrading most of my 3rd gen Echo Dots to the 5th generation.  The added funtionality of the device with onboard motion detection and temperature reading are game changing.  You can set up and endless number of routines for Alexa based on those readings.  I have 4th gen Echos paired with an Echo studio and Echo Show 8 for my sound needs.  I haven't listened to anything on the new dot to tell if the sound is better than the old dot, but my feeling is if you are using an Echo Dot as your main audion input you don't really value sound quality in the first place.  I do think it is in imporvement that the speakers are front firing since most of us have our Echos placed agaisnt a wall.  I'm enjoying all the new things I can make happen with motion detection.  Using a smart plug and space heater and Alexa now you can control room temperature thanks to it's new sensors.  I don't have an eero system but I will probably end up getting one now that when I finish upgrading my Echo Dots I'll have 4 wifi extenders already set-up.  I do love my Echos and Dots.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 5, 2023
titles: We LOVE our ALEXAS, Own 3 and gifted 3!!
reviews: \nWe love so much all our Alexa\u2019s. We have a 3rd gen, two 4th gens and 4th gen with clock and now a 5th gen as a gift. All white and charcoal. They are amazing. So helpful when needed, we listen to music daily via pandora or Amazon everyday. Great for homework or instant questions. Got this for my father whom is a doctor working from a home office via telemedicine. This was perfect for him for any questions he may have. He also bought a Samsung QLED smart TV which works with Alexa and I thought this would help him navigate how to use the television more easily. We haven\u2019t hooked anything up just yet, but excited too. The charcoal is nice coloring for his office too. So many possibilities. I have mine in LR  with smart Amazon plug which turned on off my Xmas tree. Will be getting more plugs too. So many possibilities sky is the limit. Love the payment options as well gives an opportunity to get multiple at once as gifts. Also gifted one to my Neice last year the gen white 4 and she loves it,  got same for my brother too . Amazing for all ages. Literally we are 8-78yrs. So compact easy to display. Modern looking. Picks up commands well. Gives weather if requested. Download app to make all your preferences easy and personalize it to just you.  Responds to your voice command. Name it with the small choices it gives. We have an Echo, Alexa, and a Ziggy\u2026 we chose different names for our home so when we command her they all don\u2019t go off at once. We set reminders and errand lists.  I do wish they gave more naming options for this purpose but we are lucky we have enough names for the amount owned. We love them. It\u2019s a cool device and everyone should have one! Makes life so easy at times. The pictures listed are of my white gen 4 clock choice but the gen 5 charcoal looks the same just diff color (this gen 5 doesn\u2019t have clock option) . I believe it\u2019s the software that separates the two. Wanted to give you a picture of what would look like. Connect to your Amazon account and will notify you when your packages come, and any updates regarding your account. As you see mine is lit yellow at the base stating I have a notification. Sound quality is amazing. Little goes long way.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 8, 2023
reviews: \nMany features included in this echo that previous generations don't have. For reference this is my 3rd alexa/echo device. I have a large echo that was gifted to me when they first came out and a 2nd generation echo then this one.Using the Alexa app one can monitor the temperature of the room this device is in. That is the feature I find most useful for me but it has many others than my other two don't. Really enjoy using this.\n

The sound is clearer than the echo dot gen 3; however, it is not as loud. In other words, a 3gen at volume 10 would sound louder. Another down side is the voice recognition. I have to Alexas in my room, and echo show 5, if am not mistaken, and this one. This one I have it next to me while I\u2019m on my desk. The echo show would be on the other side of the room facing my back. However, the echo show manage to pick up my voice better and faster than this echo dot, even though it should be harder for the show to do so\u2026\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 11, 2023
reviews: \nWe replaced an Echo 2 and the dot gen 3 with these gen 5 versions.  The voice recognition is getting better all the time.  We set one up on my account and one on my wife's.  If a notice comes for her and I ask, the response indicates that the notification is for another profile.  Our prior products did not do this.We did have a setup issue with one of them. The default volume was quite high.  During the startup as the device gave explanations, I was lowering volume and took the device off program.  It took a couple of retries, but ultimately the app brought up the right steps to manually connect and guide the dot gen 5 onto our wifi.  I was close to returning it as defective, but the app salvaged it.  It has worled flawlessly since.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 6, 2023
reviews: \nThis device has many more features than just telling you the weather,  setting reminders,  giving you directions and playing music,  all those features are wonderful but I like the fact it's amazing security boost,  Like it can sense a person in the room and alert your phone if you're away,  it can detect carbon monoxide detectors and smoke detectors and again alert your phone if you're away,  it can tell you the temperature of the room it is placed,  all this is free,  it will actually do a few more amazing security things but you would have to pay for that,  like detects glass breaking,  play growling dog sounds,  lol, and even summon help thru Amazon Emergency Help line,  so bottom line,  I thought this devices security features were so amazing I bought 2 of them,  small small price to pay for the feeling of knowing you will be aware if something askew at home and your no there,  like a second set of eyes and ears at home\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 7, 2023
reviews: \nWhen you need a alarm to wake up in the morning all you have to do is ask Alexa to wake u up at a time and it will start a soft progressive Chime amd get louder until you say Alexa Stop.If you like music and games you can also set up in the Alexa app to the skills (there's over 1000 to choose from).  You can also set up a announcement and it will announce any message you have.  If you have a ring doorbell connected to your Alexa app it will alert you that someone is at the door.  If you want to know the time and date and weather you can ask Alexa those.  There's plenty more that Alexa can do... the possibilities are endless.\n

reviews: \nMy house isn\u2019t super large but it is on the bigger side she can hear me from two rooms over really comes in handy when I need to set a reminder but I\u2019m in bed \U0001f923 I can make a grocery list just by standing in my kitchen and going through my fridge and pantry and shouting it out to her!We use her all the time even our daughter has started using her to ask questions about stuff she doesn\u2019t know and stuff I don\u2019t know super helpful!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 7, 2023
reviews: \nThis is the fourth  one I have purchased for myself and gifted 2 to my son.  The first 2 someone else set up for me as I am not computer savvy and know nothing about electronics.  The last 2 I had ordered, I received e-mails from Amazon telling me how to set them up before they were even shipped so all I had to do was plug them in.  No more forgetting grocery items, just tell Alexa and she will add items so you don't worry about forgetting to. My shopping lists are broken down by catagory making it easier at the store.  I love that I can tell Alexa to turn on certain lights as I am retired and use no more electricity than necessary.  There are so many helpful features, I am so glad someone convinced me that I should get one.\n

It even answers some of our dumb, spur of the moment  questions.  Sound is clear.  It always responds to 'Alexa'...we've never had to ask twice.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 25, 2023
titles: No bridge included w/ edited review
reviews: \nThese two devices are bundled together, and I thought it was a great idea. However, now that I have them both and I am attempting to connect them, I see that apparently something called a \u201cbridge\u201d is necessary for these two to pair. It is not included with the bundle. I am confused why this bundle exists without a very significant portion being included. Now, I have to wait for another device to arrive, just to connect these two devices I already have. So frustrating!**EDITED** I very quickly received a phone call from customer support and was able to get my issue resolved. She walked me through, step by step, and was very friendly. Changed my review completely! It is working now, paired with my echo dot, and I did not need a bridge to do so. The set up was a bit confusing and I don\u2019t think it is very user-friendly, but I suppose that isn\u2019t Amazon\u2019s fault. Just something to keep in mind before purchasing!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 8, 2023
reviews: \nI've had the New Echo Dot for about six months now, and it's been a great addition to my home. It connects easily to all my devices - I can control my TV, lights, and even my coffee maker with just my voice! Plus, the sound quality is really good for such a small speaker. I mostly use it for listening to music and it's been great for that. Overall, I'm really happy with my purchase and would definitely recommend it.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 22, 2022
titles: Moving from Gen4 to Gen5: A touch disappointing for Team Cheap ancient people.
reviews: \nI couldn't pass up the introductory price that included a Philips smart LED bulb. We're Alexa-fying our house as a means for dealing with reduced mobility and increased age-related incidents and needs.Yeah, we're really old. And that tempers our overall response to the Gen5 Echo Dot, which could be summed up as "Meh."We were perfectly happy with the basic Gen4 Echo Dot but found that when we wanted to add another unit, G4s are no longer sold except as 'refurbished' or 'open box' - plus the G5 intro bundle was really low cost.The Echo platform is exceptionally useful for our applications, which are out of the ordinary if you're young. For example, we've used "Alexa, turn on all lights" a couple of times for dark-of-night incidents where light has been a boon backdrop for noodling out various solutions. Light (literally) brightens up your mood when your mood is under you-just-awoke-suddenly pressures.Plus, while our house is quite modest, it's well built and pretty sound-proof, so yelling from the bedroom to the basement office just doesn't cut it. We now have Echos in every key room, so 'Alexa, drop in on everybody' gives us quick access to a house-wide intercom.But now for our disappointment. We actually have some usage for decent music reproduction, and the 3.5mm headphone output on the Gen4 Echo allows us to plug through to ancient but high-quality computer speakers scavenged from local thrift stores.No such plug is on the Gen5. Our cheap music solution is no longer possible. Sure, we could use Bluetooth speakers, but units with sound quality comparable to quality, vintage computer speakers are (a) a lot more expensive and (b) require pairing, which I've always found quirky/intermittent/frustrating with Bluetooth. Because we are really old, simply plugging a stereo jack into a Gen4 receptacle just seems easier and more reliable.And, while I kind of wanted to taste the new, higher Gen5 sound with increased bass, what I'm hearing is clearly designed for boom-a-boom thumpity thump popular music. It probably won't surprise you to find that sounds eagerly sucked up by 15-30 year olds isn't really what ancient folks like us want. Jazz, classical, (dare I say) Enya, even "Eres Tu" with its really nice descant at the end -- this is more our range, and it's stuff that requires reined-in bass, un-tinny midrange, and balanced treble.So, between audio engineering decisions and the audio-output de-contenting, for us, Gen5 is not a step up from Gen4.Like all Echos, build quality is outstanding, software capabilities are outstanding -- in fact, incredibly exciting and clearly with few limits -- and the spherical design is minimalistic and very pleasing. It was great that it took nothing more than plugging it in to marry our new G5 unit to all the other Echos dotted around our house. I'm not sorry we added a Gen5 unit, just not jumping for joy.I find myself pigeon-holing it with all the other recent New! New! Product stuff floating out there that offers less, removes wanted accessories, and otherwise pumps up corporate bottom lines at the expense of what (some) owners want.I may come back and add some more praise for the new temperature monitoring some day, but at the moment, we are years away from an Alexa-compatible thermostat...\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 15, 2023
reviews: \nMy echo dot is one of my favorite items in my house. She is very helpful and does everything I ask of her. If you have any problems with how to work it, you can always check just app or just ask alexa.\n

reviews: \nThis new, 5th generation echo dot is a HUGE improvement over the old hockey puck! It offers a much deeper, fuller and richer sound than the original. It was nice that I was able to trade my old one in for a few bucks toward the new one too. I highly recommend this item, you won't be disappointed!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 24, 2023
titles: Our first step into Alexa world!
reviews: \nWe have been very hesitant about getting anything voice activated. Not because we are paranoid about being listened to. But because we didn\u2019t think we needed it. Also, we thought there was a monthly charge. We are remodeling an old vet clinic into a home. Now we have need of a way to turn on lights from as many as 4 different doorways. After searching and searching for options, I  started looking at voice activated lighting. First, there is no monthly charge! Second, I thought we would need a bunch of equipment. Wrong there too! We bought one Echo Dot to try it out. The speaker is great for music and podcasts. But best of all, I can use it to control my kitchen ceiling fan/light from any that my Dot can hear me! Smart fixtures are not much more expensive than non smart fixtures, sometimes even cheaper. I love Alexa so much that I am buying more devices for other rooms and I am currently choosing more smart ceiling fans. And, I plan on setting up lights for my parents\u2019 home with voice control for their safety.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 30, 2023
titles: Great update to the Alexa line
reviews: \nThe All-New Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 release) is a solid choice for those looking to add a voice-controlled device to their home. The speaker boasts improved sound quality over previous generations, with clear and crisp audio that is perfect for listening to music, podcasts, or audio books. The compact design makes it easy to place the device in any room, and its modern aesthetic fits in well with any decor.One of the standout features of the Echo Dot is its integration with Amazon's Alexa voice assistant. Alexa is user-friendly and has a vast array of skills, from setting reminders and controlling smart home devices to providing information on weather, news, and more. The device also offers seamless integration with popular music streaming services such as Amazon Music, Spotify, and Apple Music.However, there are some areas where the Echo Dot falls short. The built-in microphone array is not as advanced as other smart speakers on the market, which can lead to difficulty in picking up voice commands in noisy environments. Additionally, the speaker doesn't offer the strongest bass response, so it may not be the best option for those looking to play music at high volumes.In conclusion, I would rate the All-New Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 release) as a 4-star product. It is a good choice for those looking for a compact and affordable voice-controlled device, but those seeking a high-end smart speaker or superior audio quality may want to look elsewhere. Nevertheless, I would still recommend it for anyone looking to make their home more convenient and efficient.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 19, 2023
titles: Needs a hard resent to respond as well as to Wake Word as previous Generations did
reviews: \n---- UPDATE----An Amazon Associate called me within 5 minutes of posting my 2 star review (due to wake word issue) and walked me through a fix that solved the problem immediately. You need to hard reset the device (hold down the action button for 20+ seconds, longer than you do for pairing mode) and reset unplug / replug your router.  This fixed the problem immediately.Adjusted review from 2 to 5 stars, as now it works properly and the Amazon associates were all over this.  Good customer service.----ORIGINAL REVIEW-----I like the form factor of this Echo Dot but it doesn't seem to respond to the wake word as well as the 2 previous versions (1st Gen and 3rd Gen) that I had.  The audio quality is improved over prior generation of Echos (still doesn't compare to the full Alexa, nor should it be expected to given the size differential).  And it looks a lot better than the prior versions.One downside is that this 5th gen does not come with an aux port, so cannot connect create a wired connection to speakers, as I had done in the past.Don't forget that Amazon has a trade in program for your old Alexa devices, so you can offset the cost of upgrading your Alexa devices.\n

titles: Not sure what I expected but it works fine.
reviews: \nI found the Echo dot to be very easy to set up.  I haven't had any problem connecting smart devices.  She generally does a good job answering my requests.I am disappointed with some issues with playing Amazon music through the speaker.  Sometimes the music cuts out or stops for no apparent reason.  Sometimes she plays something random and out of the blue that isn't in my Playlist.  But the biggest problem is with loudness normalization.  Each song is either louder or quieter than the previous song.  So I am constantly telling her to "turn up the volume/turn down the volume".  It is really annoying.  I have tried finding answers in the app and in the Amazon shopping q&a.  I have received unhelpful answers such as "change the volume using the buttons in top of the Echo". I like the design and how much smaller it is than the gen four Echo. It\u2019s probably about half the size, which makes it fit nice into any room.I also bought this for the wifi range extender to pair with my Eero router. It works great and was very easy to setup. While this range extender will only transmit up to 100Mbps, this is still more than enough for my everyday internet use. I\u2019ll likely buy another Dot to extend my wifi range, since it\u2019s much cheaper than an Eero range extender.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 17, 2023
reviews: \nI love this new generation Echo Dot. First of all, it's a lot more appealing than the previous model. I love that it's a sphere. And it's still a good product in general for it's main purposes. I mainly use it for adding things for my shopping list, alarms, and music... Which brings me to why I gave this 4 instead of 5 stars.... I truly thought that because this new dot was "bigger and better" that the sound would be spectacular and crystal clear. Not saying that it's not good, but it's just not great, which is slightly disappointing considering the price. It isn't very loud at it's highest volume and sometimes it just doesn't sound like the highest quality audio experience. And the bass isn't really bass-ing like I thought it would. It's a good product, I just am judging this purely as a speaker because I mainly use it for listening to music. It is veey responsive tho with it's music commands and I love that you can tap to pause now. One day I'll upgrade to a regular Echo because I just need a loud and excellent audio experience 89% of the time.\n

titles: Works great, first time having an Alexa device...
reviews: \nI've used other devices, so I wasn't sure what to expect with Alexa, but I'm in love with it now, sooo responsive, you can ask a lot of things, control your lights, your doors, and I know its nothing new, but what i love, its that you don't have to repeat a lot, its very responsive, the other devices I had, were a lil bit clumsy, asking me if what I said was correct, or doing nothing at all. That's not the case with this Echo Dot, at least from what I've been experience in this month, and I love the whisper response, you don't have to worry about waking up the person by your side, you just whisper and Alexa Whispers back, that's just amazing.\n

reviews: \nThis is a wonderful new update, better speakers a clearer sound at a low volume. See picture #1 It is active. We are trying the recognize my voice from the door 12 ft away,  that is excellent. I got into the Alexa app in the contact list and let the system know my name is not J. The integration was so fast once it was set up after 12 dots the owner of the DOTs had no problem. The other 11 DOTs in our home are great at a higher volume. The room this DOT is in, he had no problem communicating asking the DOT to do what he wants. Before we knew it, the DOT was speaking in a American male voice and its wake up word is computer. titles: New person detection feature is nice for routines
reviews: \nI\u2019m an Alexa/ Echo fanatic.  I wanted to replace one of my original echo dots.  I chose the 5th gen as I was interested in the person identifying feature as well as the temperature sensor built in.  I use these in routines in my Alexa app. The temp sensor I use to monitor a nearby gas heater.  To low and I get notifications or to high I get notified.  The person sensor allows me to establish reminders at given times when I walk into the kitchen.  Or if I\u2019m in a back room it notifies me of an entry into kitchen.\n

titles: Alexa, what would I do without you?
reviews: \nIf you have never used an Alexa, then you have to get one. I use it to turn my lights on and off. I use it to remind me that I have something on the stove, reminds me of what I need at the grocery store. I just say Alexa add milk to my grocery list. I set reminders of what time I need to leave the house every morning so that I\u2019m on time. It also reminds me every morning to start my car so I can get in the nice warm car. I also ask questions that I need to answer to like\u201chow much money will that make this week for $13.00 an hour and I\u2019ve worked 42 hours. He answers all questions like definition of words, how many steps are in the Empire State building. The uses are in less, and I cannot do without one in every room.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 3, 2023
titles: Note Eero built-in is only for 5 GHz band range
reviews: \nNot much to add.  It's an Echo Dot.  This review deals with the Eero built-in capability.  This is the ONLY reason that I upgraded to this Echo Dot (from an older Echo Dot (2nd gen)).  It's in a room where I hoped to improve my connections to a couple of Ring cameras that are on the outside walls of that room.  Well, I hooked it up and rebooted the cameras in question. Hmmm, they did not connect to the new Eero node.  Did some research and found buried in the Eero information for the Echo Dot (5th Gen) that it only communicates on the 5 GHz band.  Welp, Ring cameras communicate on the 2.4 GHz band.  Totally will not work for my need.  Wanted to get this out there for anyone that may be purchasing this new Echo Dot for its built-in Eero.  Got it for a pretty good price, so I'm keeping it.  Just wish they made the 5 GHz band information a lot more prominent in the item description.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 7, 2023
titles: If your music keeps shutting off disable tap option!
reviews: \nI bought this Echo Dot 5 to mount on a bathroom wall with a wall clip available from Amazon. I was finding that the Echo would randomly stop playing music sometimes shortly after starting to play the first track of a song list. Here is what I found... When a heavy bass section of a song would vibrate the Echo Dot in the mounting clip it would set off the Tap function. The problem was solved by disabling the Tap option in the Alexa app settings for this device! Problem solved. I've seen quite a few others complain about their music cutting off. Hopefully this suggestion will help.Other than this hicup, I am quite happy with this Echo Dot!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 22, 2022
titles: An OK upgrade but took several days (and 5 LONG support calls) to get it to extend my network
reviews: \nThis was purchased to add eero network extending support but has not worked as such so far.  Thirty minute call to eero support and was then routed to Amazon support for a 1:50 call.  The tech finally escalated it to the second level.  We'll see.  Thanks++++UPDATE++++As a echo speaker, it works GREAT.  However, since this arrived a little more than week ago, I have had 5 calls to eero support and two calls to Alexa support to get this unit to extend my eero network.  The total time on these calls exceeded 7 hours with one being 1:50 and two more at an hour each.Although the dot showed 4 bands of wi-fi signal on the eero app, the final solution provided by eero tech support was that I needed to have this new dot sitting closer (in my case, within 8 feet of my eeco router for it function as an extender).  This left it in a place (closet) that made no sense for a speaker or move my eero router into our guest bathroom.  The idea that it would improve my mesh network by having this dot 8' closer provided no value.It got shipped back to Amazon today and the frustration of wasting so much time will surely fade but not too quickly.New update (12/14/22):  when these went in sale for $25, I felt I'd give up the extender component and just use it as a better speaker than the old Dot.  The new one arrived and did not extend this time either - but after a week (and two updates from eero), I saw it was extending.  So - maybe it's OK if you are willing to deal with some frustration and/or mixed results\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 8, 2023
titles: may be a little too sensitive for its own good
reviews: \nWorks and sounds great, I'd buy it again, but I'm sitting three feet from the echo in the den, and when I say something to it, this one, in the kitchen, about 15 feet away (and obviously in another room) will answer me, even though my back is to it (so I can direct my voice at the older one). This is kind of a hassle when I want to set a timer or alarm on the one in the den, because the one in the kitchen is the one it registers on, and the alarm/timer goes off in there... so in order to set the one in the den, I have to get right on top of it and speak softly so the other one doesn't hear. Not a big enough deal to really complain about, but it is an issue.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 20, 2023
reviews: \nI\u2019m fabulously 50. First Alexa product and also bought Wifi light bulbs. Sengled is the brand I bought just for reference and will be leaving them a great review as well, but I digress. I\u2019ve always had Amazon and also pay for the music service. This little ball of Alexa plays my music while I\u2019m cleaning by me telling her what I want to hear, she turns my lights on and off or dims and brightens them when I tell her to, she\u2019ll read my books while I\u2019m busy doing something when I didn\u2019t want to put my book down, she is GLORIOUS!!! She listens better than any man, child, or dog so I recommend her highly!! I was hesitant not knowing how to set up Alexa up and this was my first time \u201cmeeting her\u201d, but she\u2019s one of my besties now!!!! Setup was easy from my phone. The app is easy, the control of lights all over my house is easy even if I\u2019m in bedroom and want the living room light off. I LOVE this broad named Alexa!!!! \U0001f602\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 21, 2022
reviews: \nUpdate: After using this a little while, also on the desk, I am coming to realize I don't like the round shape with the light ring on the bottom.  I much prefer the light ring on top, like on the Echo 3rd Gen and Echo Studio.  Also, the new tap feature is kind of silly, I doubt many people will use it (hitting a device on its surface without a button feels kind of unnatural.)  As far as the good stuff:Original review:I love the new temp sensor because I can set up routines for my other home automation devices based on the temp in different rooms.  The configurable temp range is from 36F to 95F (above or below).  I also love the motion sensor which was introduced in the previous 4th Gen.Here\u2019s a picture of one that I\u2019m using with it\u2019s built in people detection to automatically turn on the lights in the garage.  It also starts playing the news briefing when it detects motion.  Although the ultrasonic detection only detects major movements and is not as sensitive as a common PIR (infrared) sensor.I don\u2019t care about the built in eero because I use wired backhaul Ubiquiti UniFi access points for all of my WiFi (the only rock solid WiFi setup after I experimented with many).The only minor negatives: 1. the cord should be black, not white, and 2. I prefer the hockey puck shape (with rounded edges) of the 3rd Gen Echo Dot which has the light ring on top.  The low profile shape of the 3rd Gen hides on the desk better and makes it easier to quickly access the top controls.  For this reason I\u2019m only going to upgrade to 5th Gen in locations where I need the motion or temp sensor.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 24, 2022
titles: Better audio quality than 4th gen Dot, no aux jack
reviews: \nThis Echo Dot sounds pretty good for it's size. It has better audio quality over-all and more bass than the 4th gen Dot, which I also own. It also has more trebble but less mid-range than the 4th gen Dot. I prefer the audio this new way personally, but you can still adjust the equalizer on the built-in speaker if you want the mids back.One thing to note, this 5th gen Echo Dot has no aux/headphone jack, so if you want to use external speakers you have to use Bluetooth. I think the jack is useful as Bluetooth isn't always 100% reliable and disconnects sometimes. Also some older speakers don't support Bluetooth, so to use them you need a Bluetooth-to-aux adapter. I'd honestly get the older Dot if you just want to add Alexa to external speakers and don't care so much about the quality of the built-in speaker.However the built-in thermometer/temperature sensor is nice, I was able to get the indoor temp just by asking Alexa. This actually isn't the 1st device to include such a sensor, but it's the cheapest to do so thus far. Also the motion detector seems useful but I haven't played around with that feature much.I can't comment on the Wi-Fi extending capabilities because I don't have an Eero system. It would be nice if this device worked to extend other brands of mesh networks or even standalone routers...Over-all if you're looking for a speaker to fill a small to medium-sized space with decent sound on the cheap, this device is for you. But don't expect booming bass or extremely loud music for this price-range. The volume does get loud, but at higher levels it compresses the audio to sound louder while avoiding distortion.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 2, 2023
reviews: \nI love the echo dots and have one in almost every room in my house!  It is so convenient to add items to my shopping list.  I also use them to convert measurements when I'm cooking, check on the weather in my area and play music and podcasts.  There are so many things you can do with them!  My biggest complaint with the older dots was the sound quality.  I listen to music and podcasts every morning when I'm getting ready for the day.  When I'm in the shower trying to listen, I could not hear my podcasts and I could barely hear my music.  I had my phone and the dot at max volume and couldn't hear it.  When I wasn't in the shower, the sound was very tinny and sounded cheap.  This echo dot's volume and sound is so much better, and I can listen to everything when I'm showering.  My only complaint with this one is the notification light is on the bottom of the sphere so it's pretty difficult to see when it's lit up.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 30, 2022
reviews: \nI have lots of echo devices (dots, echoes, shows, flex) and this was probably the easiest to set up.  Just opened Alexa and it detected that a device was ready for set up, didn't have to enter passwords for wifi either, just selected network (all my smart devices are on one network while other stuff on another).  Sound isn't bad, will see how it does as part of a multiroom set up, but I have to confess I don't have much luck with multi-room music with the Echoes, it always seems to have issues - I get messages saying it's playing somewhere else but it's not, it cuts out, buffers and just stops or doesn't start at all.I really bought this because it says it has a temperature sensor which I wanted so I can check the temperature where my birds are without having to physically read the thermometer where they are so I can now set up a routine to turn on or off the fans when the temperature is above or below a certain value.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 30, 2022
titles: It's An Echo (Temperature Doesn't Work Well)
reviews: \nI bought three of these to update three original First Generation Echos.  Selecting the choice when ordering to have these preconfigured to my account made setup extremely easy.  And they seem to work well, except one thing.  The inside temperature thermometer is not accurate on any of the units.  They all read 2-7 degrees cold, and don't seem to respond much at all to changes in room temperature.  I was sort of looking forward to this feature, but primarily bought the updated units because they were on sale and my old ones were past getting security updates.Although I have Eero mesh routers I have not tried the router extender function on these for two reasons.  First, I don't have a wide area to cover and I've found with other mesh systems you can have too many connection points.  My three router pods are adequate.  Second, I keep these devices on my guest network, and the extender function won't work on guest networks.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 26, 2022
titles: Sounds better then my previous Echo Dot ....
reviews: \n- This particular Echo Dot DOES sound better then the Original Echo Dot I purchased a couple of years ago. No issue with setup etc - did run into a odd issue with a particular skill - asked Alexa to play a particular skill - Alexa wouldn't play the skill on this new Dot - played the skill on the old Dot which is located in a totally different room - very odd - spent about a hours with Amazon Tech support whom helped my work through the issue - apparently there is a known bug when you use "Groups" & enable the "all" option - you need to delete the Default Groups & re-create them - or not use Groups & disable to the "all" option - it was a weird issue & even stranger resolution - nothing todo with the Echo Dot itself - just something in the base coding is all I can figure of the Alexa skill set ... love this new DOT does sound SO much better ...\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 27, 2022
titles: Great product that didn't fit my needs
reviews: \nOverall, this is a great product!!!  I purchased it as I needed to extend my wifi and thought this was a great concept.  Replace an old Dot and get wifi extension for eero without the added device.  Set up was super easy.  The only problem was the Wifi extension would not work for me.  After set up and then getting eero to activate the wifi extension I started getting messages that it would not.  eventually telling me that it was to close to another eero device.  I am in the area of the house signal is week, were I need the extension to exist.  If I moved the device further away into the next area it did connect and worked fine.  Unfortunately that put it into my garage where I did not want this device I need.  Apparently, My house is not that big.  So Ultimately it worked great.  I just couldn't set up the wifi extension as I needed another 10 feet.  So I returned and bought another eero that worked fine and the old Dot still works wonderfully.  Make sure you have enough distance from another erro module for the wifi extension feature to work.\n

reviews: \nAlexa was very easy to set up. I connected her to my phone, t.v., bedside lamp and speakers so far. Yes, speakers, plural. It's very easy to connect a speaker  in multiple locations. My only frown here is the wires. I'm accustomed to wireless everything. I labeled the charger. I suggest doing it as well. So many chargers look the same. The original charger is always better, but a replacement charger  is  available. There are tons of accessories I have found here too.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 28, 2022
reviews: \nThe lighting in an outbuilding is powered by Wi-Fi light bulbs and can be conveniently operated remotely.  That only worked if on premises if there was a means of turning them on and off there without using the switch.Enter Echo.The building is about 30 feet from the home where the Wi-Fi base is located.  Initially, pairing an eeros extender with the Echo did the trick.This newest Echo, with eeros built-in replaced two devices with one, freeing up the eeros extender for better use around the home.The reception/signal is not as strong as the stand alone eeros, but it\u2019s adequate nonetheless.  Note that the Echo with eeros built in appears to have been designed to use the Wi-Fi extender feature only if it determines it is needed, strange but fine.One less device, same convenient functionality. Note:  the device only works with an eeros base unit, often bundled with the new gen Echo for those who do not already have one.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 1, 2023
reviews: \nThese are the best productive enjoyment technology in years!  Amazingly easy to *) Set Appointment Reminder *) Set Timers for Cooking *) Retrieve best huge volume of music at your fingertips to listen to *) Assess the daily and weekly weather at moment's notice *) Control smart lights by voice to turn on and off *) Wake up Alarm *) Retrieve store hours and movie times nearby *) Request answers to common questions related to math conversions, history, proper spelling of words, and tons of research.  Each home should have several.  I recommend an echo show in the kitchen to actually drop in on close family and view recipes.  The echo dots are able to be used as a phone simply by asking them to call a phone number.  If you have any family member that is vision impaired, you must consider the entire echo line as a best assistant reading for you and everything mentioned above simply by voice commands.  Great to retrieve stock market prices.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 11, 2022
titles: Temperature sensor is not good. (UPDATE: Its better now.)
reviews: \nEDIT: Amazon has rolled out an update that greatly increases the accuracy of the sensor. It still seems a bit off, I will return after more testing.Below is my original review.I purchased a 5th gen dot to replace my 4th gen for one reason; the temperature sensor. And it is not accurate enough to mean anything. I was suspicious early on, I would have Alexa tell me the temp when I was cool and when I was extremely hot.Today I got a cheap temperature sensor and I can already tell it is way more accurate than the Echo Dot. The dot is off by 4 degrees and seems to update hourly at best.It's still useful as an echo dot, but the temperature sensor is uselessly bad.I threw away the box already otherwise I would return it.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 2, 2022
titles: Solid upgrade besides the temperature sensor being inaccurate
reviews: \nUPDATE 12/13/22 - I have to applaud Amazon CS for reaching out to me and working to resolve the temperature bug. After receiving the most recent software update today it resolved my issues with temperature. and I can now enjoy full functionality of this unit! Raised a star to 4/5I upgraded from my 3rd gen and so far, I do like the improved sound and design. It seems to hear my voice easier than my older Dot. BUT I did purchase this mostly for the temperature sensor which seems to not be accurate at all. I have a separate sensor in two different rooms and two different 5th Gen Dot's. Each one reads 10 degrees colder than my sensors which I know to be accurate. I am not sure if this is something that can be addressed via software updates, but I would not recommend purchasing this for the temperature sensor alone. It simply doesn't work\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 29, 2022
titles: Good for a first Echo Dot
reviews: \nI've been wanting an Echo Dot for the longest time now, and when I saw this one was $27 for the holidays, I FINALLY jumped the bandwagon and got one. I've got Fire Sticks on every TV in the house, so it's not my first time with Alexa, but I wanted something in my room at night besides my phone to listen to music, and so far it's been a joy to use. Super easy to set up, just had to link my Spotify account and she was good to go!Sound quality is great, and the bass is great, too. Voice Recognition is decent, though you might have to be clearer with Alexa on certain things, but other than that, I don't see any problems at all. I'll update this review in like a few months or so, but so far I'm very happy with my purchase!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 1, 2023
titles: Get this model if you don't need the clock
reviews: \nI have been a fan of all the Echo devices and the fifth generation Echo Dot is no exception. Initially, I purchased the version with a clock for my bedroom, but ended up replacing it with the one without the clock. One reason for this was that the numbers on the clock were too small to see from across the room, and the light emitted by the numbers was a little too blue for sleeping. I moved the clocked version to another room where these issues were not a factor. After using the fifth generation Echo Dot without a clock, I found that the sound quality is good, but not significantly different from my fourth generation Echo Dot once I adjusted the tone settings in the Alexa app. Overall, I am very happy with my fifth generation Echo Dot and would recommend it to others.\n

reviews: \nI use this Echo Dot in my master bedroom to listen to music and for a back-up alarm. It\u2019s a very fine adjunct to my Echo in the living room. dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 9, 2023
reviews: \nI have 7 Echo Dot devices spread throughout a 2 BR/2 Bath apartment. 4 Gen 2 (3 with Skywin enhancement), 2 Gen 3 (with subs), and 1 Gen 5,  They all get along in an Everywhere group, approaching the Sonos System sound. NB: I have often called this setup a "Poor Man's Sonos System. The Gen 5 outshines all of the earlier versions! It delivers the same rich range of mid-level, treble tones, and deep bass of my Gen 3-with-sub setup! Remaining a Poor Man, it's the not-a-Sonos-System which I can afford!Looks like Amazon is closing out the Echo Dot line (look at the prices)! Maybe I'll bank a couple more of them.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 30, 2022
reviews: \nWe all love having our own Alexa devices, there are fun games, we can communicate from room to room, make announcements, my favorite feature is the drop in feature so I can call home and check in without having to have a house phone. Kids love engaging and asking it a million questions to test its knowledge and learn new things. The escape room games are my personal favorite but some of them are really glitchy and don\u2019t work right. But overall I love these Alexa devices and the lights that work with them. The sengeled ones work the best, I have them in half of our rooms now. Also it works with my video ring bell so we don\u2019t miss a guest due to dogs barking lol\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 20, 2022
reviews: \nThis product is so much fun! I have it hooked up to a smart light and all I have to say is \u201cAlexa, turn on the lamp\u201d and bam on comes the lamp. It is so handy to me because the switch for my lamp is clear behind my bed so to get to it is a pain.  But now I can ask Alexa to do it and no more blindly trying to find the switch.When I want to listen to Pandora, all I have to say is \u201cAlexa play pandora\u201d and bam it starts playing. Ask her the weather, bam she knows it and tells it. It is so nice and handy.The sound quality is super! It sounds like a big speaker playing but actually this big sound is coming from this small speaker.I\u2019m so glad I bought this product. It can do so much more I just need to play around with it more. So fun! And so handy!\n

reviews: \nYou can pretty much ask her anything like having a buttleress, she is so smart and Alexa can even turn on power outlets for lights, fan and I even turn on my in sink erator or sink grinder using alexa. You can make it connect to your bluetooth speakers and the music will play thru your bigger and better sounding bluetooth speakers, it can also pair all your alexa enabled speakers so you can play the songs all over the house. Any gadget that shows Alexa enabled this little echo can control it. It can dim your lights and switches that are Alexa enabled, unlimited possibilities. I might look into the car echo because I read that it can control a few things like start the car, turn on the heater, etc.\n

reviews: \nIn cleaning and setting up my enclosed porch for year-round use, I wanted a voice assistant to control the lighting.  Adding the Dot provide all the advantages of Alexa voice control for an automated area.  I use mine along with a SONOS sound system to make every area of my home an area to relax and rock out.  The DOT adds easy control to my SONOS speakers.  I use it multiple times a day to play music from the Amazon Music Library.  Although I have a Library of several hundred albums that are available on SONOS, it is far easier to ask Alexa to play almost any song.\n

reviews: \nThe 5th Gen is pretty much the same as the 4th. I don\u2019t use my dots as alarms so the tap to snooze function is kind of irrelevant for me. I find AppleTV 4K has much better performance than the fire 4K so that\u2019s what\u2019s connected to our home theater with fires in the bedrooms. titles: Sounds The Same As My 4th Gen Without Clock
reviews: \nI was excited about the promise of this having "the best sound yet" of the echo dots. Fortunately the price was right so I'll be keeping it, but it's not necessarily any better than the larger 4th gen. The 4th gen actually sounds a little better, as it projects more and packs a good punch for a small speaker. This one is fine, just not personally hearing the noticeable improvement that the description boasts. I'm thoroughly confused as to why the black 4th gen I have is larger than both this 5th gen, and my blue 4th gen dot with clock. The larger 4th gen without clock is STILL the best sounding echo that I have, including an echo show. The contrasts are blatant when you use them mostly just for music.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 24, 2022
titles: Don't buy if you want to use as access point (extender)  UPDATES
reviews: \nThe Echo was very simple to set up. My Echo ran a firmware update immediately. I then was asked to update EERO, both updates ran smoothly. I then launched the EERO app and turned on Eero built in. I keep getting error message to check for software update. Already done !  I have jacked with this for over 3 hours. I rebooted Echo and eero and even my modem  The only way to get the error to go away is turn off eero built in. The only reason I bought this junk is to extend WIFI. I recently received ASTRO and have already had issues with that. Not happy Amazon customer.  ****This appears to be a problem with EERO and not the dot. I have an open work order with them to troubleshoot the issue. We were not able to get it working though my initial call. Tam from Amazon was amazing  thanks for caring.  I was shocked that I received a call.\n
config_color: Color: CharcoalConfiguration: with eero Wifi Mesh Router

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 26, 2022
titles: A Must-Have for Any Smart Home
reviews: \nThe All-New Echo Dot (5th Gen) has quickly become a staple in my smart home setup. The device is compact, easy to set up, and has a sleek modern design that fits perfectly into any room.One of the standout features of the Echo Dot is its voice control capabilities. With Amazon's virtual assistant, Alexa, I can control my smart home devices, play music, and get answers to my questions simply by using my voice. It's a convenient and hassle-free way to stay connected and in control of my home. For example, I can turn off the lights in my bedroom or adjust the thermostat without ever having to leave my couch. I can also ask Alexa to play my favorite playlist or set a timer for when I'm cooking dinner. The options are endless and it's amazing how much easier it has made my daily routine.In addition to its voice control capabilities, the Echo Dot also has impressive sound quality. It's clear and crisp, making it perfect for streaming music or listening to audiobooks. I particularly love using it to listen to podcasts or music while I'm working or relaxing at home.Overall, I highly recommend the All-New Echo Dot (5th Gen) to anyone looking to upgrade their smart home or add voice control to their home. It's a game-changing device that I use on a daily basis and has made my life so much more convenient. The setup process is a breeze and the device is very user-friendly, so even if you're not tech-savvy, you'll have no problem getting it up and running. If you're on the fence about purchasing the Echo Dot, I can confidently say that it's worth the investment. You won't be disappointed!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 20, 2023
reviews: \ngreat\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 5, 2023
reviews: \nHad issues getting to know my hue light but tech support is 5 star and got me the information which allowed me to work out the issue myself. Great learning session. I use it everyday for weather, news, even sleep sounds: I found brown noise is relaxing but pink noise makes vivid dreaming! Nice side effect. I am planning my expension and building a smart system. Very cool and handy even for this 66 yo techhead!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 29, 2022
titles: Game Changer and sooo much fun!
reviews: \nI bought the Alexa in white for my 12 year old daughter for Christmas...now I want one for myself! First of all, we already have one Alexa in the house that belongs to my 16 year old son and he mostly uses it for listening to music and controlling his bluetooth LED lights and lightbulb in his room! My daughter didn't ask for the Alexa, but since she does have the bluetooth lights in her room, I figured she may enjoy being able to do voice control commands like her brother. I also ordered her a bluetooth lighbulb for her ceiling fan that works with Alexa! She has had an absolute blast controlling the lights in her room; the bulb I ordered can do every possible shade of color under the Sun...so my daughter is literally in her room like, "Alexa change my light to hot pink...Alexa change my light to beige..." It is SO cool! When she can't sleep, she simply says, "Alexa play meditative storm sounds" and Alexa replies with her options... for FREE of course! We can also ask her to read my daughter a bedtime story and she reads a story. Her Dad and I even creeped by her room and said really loud, "Alexa, play ZZ TOP!" just to annoy her lmao It's been so much fun and Alexa, like Siri, can answer just about any question or complete just about any task you ask of her. Definitely a quality purchase and worth every penny!\n

titles: A good gift for my dad
reviews: \nMy dad really enjoys having a Alexa speaker in the house. My dad is getting older and he doesn\u2019t know how to work newer technology on his own unless I\u2019m there. Having a Alexa echo dot made it easier for him. All he has to say is, \u201cHey Alexa! Play me some country music.\u201d Hey Alexa! Set me an alarm for work. He loves it.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 27, 2022
reviews: \nIn the bedroom I have a projector that I use to play on the wall TV shows and late night news before I go to bed the projector is one of those cheap projectors from China. It\u2019s a good projector however it has its flaws. The sound quality is absolute crap and the fan is loud. I eventually got used to the mono sound (which had to be turned up because the fan is so loud) I recently got the new echo 5 gen and fire stick 4k max during primeday. I and what a complete 180\xb0 difference it is. You can connect the echo with the fire stick and use that as the audio! At first I was worried about there being a delay and the voice not being in sync since I was using a projector. Never had an issue. I have excellent sound now and I\u2019m planning on purchasing another echo to have a both sides of the bed. If anyone uses a projector with a Firestick I highly suggest you get this echo for your sound to replace the projector speakers.\n

reviews: \nI have liked the other Echos and dots I have 2nd and 3rd gen. This new round dot is heads and tales above the others. Recognizing and carrying out requests is so much easier. It will hear you the first time and get almost each request done the first time. The sound is also much better even though I thought the older dots sounded good these are much nicer sound. I marked the CS down on other help I have gotten with the units. It has not always been helpful. An I don\u2019t know or will have the next level tech support call and never getting the call. I guess they might have been good because it made me look for an answer. Would very much recommend updating they are worth it.\n

This is an added charge for you need the $99 router first.I also have a Gen 4 and sound quality is supposed to be better with the 5th. Ironically I found the sound better on the 4th and after a quick research, turns out I wasn't the only one.Otherwise, love this Echo . I use it to control all my smart devices. titles: Great product for full price or even better on sale
reviews: \nI purchased the 5th Gen Echo Dot and the light bulb together for under $30.  I would consider that a steal.  Just the Dot for under $30 is a steal.  I have multiple Echo Dots and I have gifted multiple Echo Dots. Additionally, all of my external subscriptions are usable on the Dot (like Pandora). The 5th Gen is an overall improvement with better sound quality and it tells the internal temperature (and by the way - if only ever used to ask outside weather conditions - the Dot is a great household item to have).\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 1, 2022
reviews: \nI now have 3 echo\u2019s (4th gen) 3 dot\u2019s(4th gen) 1 dot(5th gen) and 2 dot\u2019s (2nd gen). As far as the Echo smart speakers, I love them. They sound great on their own or paired together in a stereo configuration(much better). To have synchronized sound throughout the entire house as easy as this is just awesome. Having smart lights and plugs, everything is voice controlled. Even my smart TV since it\u2019s Alexa ready. After I updated my software, since I kind of forgot I had those old dot\u2019s, everything set themselves up on their own. I of course had to tell them what room they were in. It wasn\u2019t hard to set up my house and now it\u2019s all voice activated. The upgrade to high def digital sound in Amazon Music is a must, you will be able to hear the difference. Since I got my gen 2 dot\u2019s, which were a pain in the a@# to control my lights by voice and music only sounded good through my stereo, they have greatly improved. You can get an Echo, not the dot, for 50 bucks on sale. It\u2019s comparable to something worth 3 or 4 times that. The gen 5 dot sounds great in a smaller room. Good base for such a little thing. The 4th gens were good but the 5th is a little clearer and deeper.\n
